project: RP9 framework: RP9_Relational_Primacy_Framework title: README subtitle: A Closed Relational System for Structural Generation version: "1.0" status: locked author: Anton Wallin alias: Co-Creator audience: public academic technical classification: pre-formal framework relational ontology geometric primacy closed derivation system scope: ontology geometry mathematics topology physical emergence principles: relation is primary no external assumptions no forces, objects, or dimensions postulated method: internal derivation causal necessity structural elimination constraints: no symbolic interpretation no metaphysics no empirical claims license: CC-BY-NC-SA-4.0 repository: root: https://github.com/AntonWallin999 branch: main tags: RP9 relational primacy vesica piscis geometric relation invariant structure energy as relation closed system date: 2026-01-10 This repository contains the complete, locked formulation of RP9 ‚Äî Relational Primacy Framework.RP9 is a closed relational system built from: a single axiom, a strict causal derivation, and a finite relational function space. No external assumptions are introduced. No empirical claims are made. No symbolic or metaphysical interpretation is required.This README serves solely as the structural entry point to the framework.The material is intentionally minimal and divided into three non-overlapping layers. Each layer has a strictly defined role.This level contains the entire foundation of RP9.Documents in this layer: establish the single axiom, define the minimal functional terms, and prove the core theorem and its corollary. Nothing in later layers can modify or extend this level.If this level is invalid, the entire framework collapses. If this level holds, everything that follows is necessary.This level contains the complete relational unfolding of the axiom.It shows: how the axiom becomes geometric without measurement, how recursion introduces balance, and how fusion of relations produces a closed functional matrix. No new axioms appear here. No constants are assumed. All structures are consequences.This level completes the internal system.This level does not add validity to RP9.It exists to: show convergence with existing practices (e.g. invariance testing), provide a public abstract, and offer a minimal visual comparison. These documents are illustrative, not evidentiary.They may be omitted without affecting the framework.For formal evaluation: RP9 ‚Äì Axiom 0 Definition F0 Theorem T0 Corollary C0 Relational Sheet (A) Relational Sheet (B) Relational Sheet (C) All other documents are optional.RP9 is not: a physical theory, a model with tunable parameters, a collection of examples, a symbolic system, or an empirical hypothesis. RP9 does not explain phenomena. It defines the minimal conditions under which structure is possible. The framework is structurally complete. The derivation is closed. No further axioms can be added without breaking necessity. This repository therefore represents RP9 v1.0 (locked).The framework is released under CC-BY-NC-SA-4.0.You may: read, share, reference, and build upon the material, provided attribution is given and derivative work preserves the same license.End of README.project: RP9 framework: RP9_Relational_Primacy_Framework title: APPENDIX subtitle: A Closed Relational System for Structural Generation version: "1.0" status: locked author: Anton Wallin alias: Co-Creator audience: public academic technical classification: pre-formal framework relational ontology geometric primacy closed derivation system scope: ontology geometry mathematics topology physical emergence principles: relation is primary no external assumptions no forces, objects, or dimensions postulated method: internal derivation causal necessity structural elimination constraints: no symbolic interpretation no metaphysics no empirical claims license: CC-BY-NC-SA-4.0 repository:

A single axiom (Axiom 0) A strict causal derivation External convergence without dependence on external authority This is exactly the right balance between: minimalism precision verifiability More material would not strengthen this. It would rather: dilute causality open more attack points give reviewers more areas to miss the point The intention is therefore: ‚Äùmore quality, less quantity‚Äù All necessary features are already represented: RP9 ‚Äì Axiom 0 Relational Sheet (A, B, C) Theorem T0 / Definition F0 / Corollary C0 Public Abstract (External Convergence) Single-slide invariance comparison ‚úîÔ∏è All of this is present. Interpretation protocol Forbidden interpretation operations Human‚ÄìAI usage ‚úîÔ∏è These are optional to show, but critical to have. Good thing they are separate documents.You should not convince through accumulation. You should do this: Show the only place where everything is already decided. That is: Axiom 0 the causal derivation and the external invariance convergence Everything else is secondary.A distinction that is crucial. The system is not closed The circuit is closed The cause is completely given All further consequences are open, but causally bound This means that we shouldn't write any Final Lock Declaration. Instead, we should write APPENDIX.md so that it communicates just this: RP9 closes nothing ‚Äî it states the cause, and leaves the consequences open.This appendix contains supplementary material related to the RP9 framework.It does not extend, modify, or complete the system. Its sole purpose is to provide a structured space for derivative, optional, or exploratory material that may arise from the primary framework.RP9 establishes a closed relational circuit: the primary relation is fully specified the causal origin is complete no further foundational assumptions are possible This closure applies only to the origin.The framework does not define a closed system.Once the relational cause is given, all further structure, behavior, and manifestation are free to unfold, provided they remain consistent with the primary relation.RP9 therefore: closes the cause but leaves the consequences open Material placed here may include: alternative geometric projections extended relational matrices domain-specific applications visualizations, simulations, or models comparative mappings to other frameworks All such material is: non-foundational optional context-dependent None of it is required for the validity of RP9.This appendix may not contain: new axioms revisions of Axiom 0 redefinitions of relational terms modifications of the relational sheets (A‚ÄìC) Any such change would constitute a different framework, not an extension.All material in this appendix carries local causal responsibility.That is: authors are responsible for their own derivations consequences are not endorsed as necessary validity is domain-specific, not global RP9 provides the cause. The appendix records what others do with it.This appendix is intentionally open-ended.Its existence does not imply incompleteness of the framework, but rather acknowledges that a closed cause does not imply a closed world.End of APPENDIX.project: RP9 framework: RP9_Relational_Primacy_Framework title: Corollary C0 subtitle: A Closed Relational System for Structural Generation version: "1.0" status: locked author: Anton Wallin alias: Co-Creator audience: public academic technical classification: pre-formal framework relational ontology geometric primacy closed derivation system scope: ontology geometry mathematics topology physical emergence principles: relation is primary no external assumptions no forces, objects, or dimensions postulated method: internal derivation causal necessity structural elimination constraints: no symbolic interpretation no metaphysics no empirical claims license: CC-BY-NC-SA-4.0 repository:

root: https://github.com/AntonWallin999 branch: main tags: RP9 relational primacy vesica piscis geometric relation invariant structure energy as relation closed system date: 2026-01-10 Everything that can exist, function or manifest must appear as a relationship between two distinct poles.This relation is not an object, not a property, and not a magnitude, without the only natural and primary function that enables stability, causality and structure.The relationship precedes all form, all energy, all geometry, all dimension and all mathematical representation. All differentiation, all organization, and all invariance are necessary consequences of this relation when realized as a self-organizing, fractal, geometric function.This axiom is: non-numeric non-geometric non-temporal and independent of observation It cannot be reduced to something more fundamental, and cannot be denied without self-contradiction.Axiom 0 states that: A singular, undifferentiated state lacks function and therefore cannot form the basis of any structure. Function requires differentiation. Differentiation requires relationship. Relationship requires at least two poles. Thus dual relationship is not an assumption, but a necessity for anything to function at all.The following are not assumptions, but inevitable consequences of Axiom 0: Stability only occurs through relational balance. Causality arises as direction within relationship. Self-organization occurs when the relationship is iterated. Fractal structure occurs when the same relationship appears scale-independent. Geometry arises as the first stable projection of the relationship. Energy arises as relational rotation. Invariance arises as relational conservation principle. Mathematics arises as a secondary description of relational structure. An axiom is only legitimate if it cannot be derived from anything else and cannot be further reduced.Each additional axiom necessarily introduces at least one of the following: a hidden assumption a limitation of generality or an interpretive degree of freedom that violates causal necessity RP9 therefore uses exactly one axiom, because additional axioms do not strengthen a foundational system ‚Äî they weaken it.The single axiom used in RP9 is not a detail, not a constraint, and not a structural preference. It is the smallest possible functional requirement for anything to exist, function, or differentiate at all.This axiom operates at the root level, prior to geometry, energy, dimension, or mathematics. It is minimal in content, yet sufficient in capacity to recursively generate the entire relational and geometric structure of reality as a consequence of the same underlying relation.All higher-order structures ‚Äî including geometry, fractal scaling, invariance, and mathematical representation ‚Äî arise not as assumptions, but as necessary consequences of this single relational function.RP9 therefore contains: one axiom zero free parameters and no auxiliary postulates Everything else is derivation.If more than one axiom is required, it follows that: the system is not causally closed or that certain consequences are not necessary RP9's goal is not to postulate structure, but to show what must follow if function is to be possible at all.Axiom 0 is the only statement that: cannot be derived cannot be avoided and cannot be replaced Everything else in RP9 is deduction, consequence or presentation.RP9 strictly distinguishes between: Axiom ‚Äì that which cannot be otherwise Consequence ‚Äì that which must follow Presentation ‚Äì how consequences are shown, modeled or visualized Energy models, rotation models, dimensional transitions and mathematical formalisms are therefore validating projections, not supporting foundations.The validity of the system rests solely on Axiom 0.RP9 is a system with: an axiom zero free parameters and full causal closure All complexity in RP9 is emergent, not assumed. If absolute relational duality holds, RP9 follows. If it doesn't apply, nothing can work at all. This document is ready for submission, filing and external review.If you want, the next step could be to: mark exactly which documents are formally relegated to consequences, or write an "Instructions to Reviewers" page stating how this should be read correctly. project: RP9 framework: RP9_Relational_Primacy_Framework title: Theorem T0 subtitle: A Closed Relational System for Structural Generation version: "1.0" status: locked author: Anton Wallin alias: Co-Creator audience: public academic technical classification: pre-formal framework relational ontology geometric primacy closed derivation system scope: ontology geometry mathematics topology physical emergence principles: relation is primary no external assumptions no forces, objects, or dimensions postulated method: internal derivation causal necessity structural elimination constraints: no symbolic interpretation no metaphysics no empirical claims license: CC-BY-NC-SA-4.0 repository:

and the external invariance convergence
Everything else is secondary.A distinction that is crucial. The system is not closed The circuit is closed The cause is completely given All further consequences are open, but causally bound This means that we shouldn't write any Final Lock Declaration.
Instead, we should write APPENDIX.md so that it communicates just this:
RP9 closes nothing ‚Äî it states the cause, and leaves the consequences open.This appendix contains supplementary material related to the RP9 framework.It does not extend, modify, or complete the system.
Its sole purpose is to provide a structured space for derivative, optional, or exploratory material that may arise from the primary framework.RP9 establishes a closed relational circuit:
the primary relation is fully specified the causal origin is complete no further foundational assumptions are possible This closure applies only to the origin.The framework does not define a closed system.Once the relational cause is given, all further structure, behavior, and manifestation are free to unfold, provided they remain consistent with the primary relation.RP9 therefore:
closes the cause but leaves the consequences open Material placed here may include:
alternative geometric projections extended relational matrices domain-specific applications visualizations, simulations, or models comparative mappings to other frameworks All such material is:
non-foundational optional context-dependent None of it is required for the validity of RP9.This appendix may not contain:
new axioms revisions of Axiom 0 redefinitions of relational terms modifications of the relational sheets (A‚ÄìC) Any such change would constitute a different framework, not an extension.All material in this appendix carries local causal responsibility.That is:
authors are responsible for their own derivations consequences are not endorsed as necessary validity is domain-specific, not global RP9 provides the cause.
The appendix records what others do with it.This appendix is intentionally open-ended.Its existence does not imply incompleteness of the framework, but rather acknowledges that a closed cause does not imply a closed world.End of APPENDIX.

rp9_publicity_package/level-1-relational.icon: <svg class="svg-icon lucide-file" stroke-linejoin="round" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" viewBox="0 0 24 24" height="24" width="24" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"><path d="M15 2H6a2 2 0 0 0-2 2v16a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2V7Z"></path><path d="M14 2v4a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h4"></path></svg>
rp9_publicity_package/level-1-relational.description:
Everything that can exist, function or manifest must appear as a relationship between two distinct poles.This relation is not an object, not a property, and not a magnitude,
without the only natural and primary function that enables stability, causality and structure.The relationship precedes all form, all energy, all geometry, all dimension and all mathematical representation.
All differentiation, all organization, and all invariance are necessary consequences of this relation when realized as a self-organizing, fractal, geometric function.This axiom is:
non-numeric
non-geometric
non-temporal
and independent of observation
It cannot be reduced to something more fundamental, and cannot be denied without self-contradiction.Axiom 0 states that:
A singular, undifferentiated state lacks function and therefore cannot form the basis of any structure.
Function requires differentiation.
Differentiation requires relationship.
Relationship requires at least two poles.
Thus dual relationship is not an assumption, but a necessity for anything to function at all.The following are not assumptions, but inevitable consequences of Axiom 0:
Stability only occurs through relational balance.
Causality arises as direction within relationship.
Self-organization occurs when the relationship is iterated.
Fractal structure occurs when the same relationship appears scale-independent.
Geometry arises as the first stable projection of the relationship.
Energy arises as relational rotation.
Invariance arises as relational conservation principle.
Mathematics arises as a secondary description of relational structure.
An axiom is only legitimate if it cannot be derived from anything else and cannot be further reduced.Each additional axiom necessarily introduces at least one of the following:
a hidden assumption a limitation of generality or an interpretive degree of freedom that violates causal necessity RP9 therefore uses exactly one axiom, because additional axioms do not strengthen a foundational system ‚Äî they weaken it.The single axiom used in RP9 is not a detail, not a constraint, and not a structural preference.
It is the smallest possible functional requirement for anything to exist, function, or differentiate at all.This axiom operates at the root level, prior to geometry, energy, dimension, or mathematics.
It is minimal in content, yet sufficient in capacity to recursively generate the entire relational and geometric structure of reality as a consequence of the same underlying relation.All higher-order structures ‚Äî including geometry, fractal scaling, invariance, and mathematical representation ‚Äî arise not as assumptions, but as necessary consequences of this single relational function.RP9 therefore contains:
one axiom zero free parameters and no auxiliary postulates Everything else is derivation.If more than one axiom is required, it follows that:
the system is not causally closed
or that certain consequences are not necessary
RP9's goal is not to postulate structure, but to show what must follow if function is to be possible at all.Axiom 0 is the only statement that:
cannot be derived
cannot be avoided
and cannot be replaced
Everything else in RP9 is deduction, consequence or presentation.RP9 strictly distinguishes between:
Axiom ‚Äì that which cannot be otherwise
Consequence ‚Äì that which must follow
Presentation ‚Äì how consequences are shown, modeled or visualized
Energy models, rotation models, dimensional transitions and mathematical formalisms are therefore validating projections, not supporting foundations.The validity of the system rests solely on Axiom 0.RP9 is a system with:
an axiom
zero free parameters
and full causal closure
All complexity in RP9 is emergent, not assumed.
If absolute relational duality holds, RP9 follows.
If it doesn't apply, nothing can work at all.
This document is ready for submission, filing and external review.If you want, the next step could be to:
mark exactly which documents are formally relegated to consequences, or
write an "Instructions to Reviewers" page stating how this should be read correctly.

When Vesica Piscis is analyzed relationally ‚Äì not numerically ‚Äì certain quotients appear as unchangeable.The equilateral triangle that can be necessarily inscribed in Vesica Piscis has a height‚Äìbase relation that cannot vary.This relation is expressed as:This is: not a measurement result not a chosen number It is a geometric necessity that follows directly from the symmetry of the relation.When the same relation is related to rotation, a relation between circumference and diameter arises that is independent of scale.This relation is expressed as:Here œÄ does not appear as a number, but as: rotation invariance closedness ratio relational circularity œÄ is thus a function consequence, not a definition.The quotients that appear here: ‚àö3 œÄ are primary relational consequences.They: require no iteration require no discretization require no algebra They arise immediately when the relation is realized geometrically.This sheet deals only with primary relational functions.The following are therefore not included here: recursive proportions discrete sequences secondary symmetry groups These belong to subsequent layers.The relation sheet (A) states that: Vesica Piscis is the first stable geometric realization of absolute relational duality ‚àö3 and œÄ are unavoidable invariant quotients in this realization no mathematical constants are introduced as assumptions mathematics functions here exclusively as descriptive language The relation creates the quotients.

rp9_publicity_package/readme.html.description:
This repository contains the complete, locked formulation of RP9 ‚Äî Relational Primacy Framework.RP9 is a closed relational system built from:
a single axiom, a strict causal derivation, and a finite relational function space. No external assumptions are introduced.
No empirical claims are made.
No symbolic or metaphysical interpretation is required.This README serves solely as the structural entry point to the framework.The material is intentionally minimal and divided into three non-overlapping layers.
Each layer has a strictly defined role.This level contains the entire foundation of RP9.Documents in this layer:
establish the single axiom, define the minimal functional terms, and prove the core theorem and its corollary. Nothing in later layers can modify or extend this level.If this level is invalid, the entire framework collapses.
If this level holds, everything that follows is necessary.This level contains the complete relational unfolding of the axiom.It shows:
how the axiom becomes geometric without measurement, how recursion introduces balance, and how fusion of relations produces a closed functional matrix. No new axioms appear here.
No constants are assumed.
All structures are consequences.This level completes the internal system.This level does not add validity to RP9.It exists to:
show convergence with existing practices (e.g. invariance testing), provide a public abstract, and offer a minimal visual comparison. These documents are illustrative, not evidentiary.They may be omitted without affecting the framework.For formal evaluation:
RP9 ‚Äì Axiom 0
Definition F0
Theorem T0
Corollary C0
Relational Sheet (A)
Relational Sheet (B)
Relational Sheet (C)
All other documents are optional.RP9 is not:
a physical theory, a model with tunable parameters, a collection of examples, a symbolic system, or an empirical hypothesis. RP9 does not explain phenomena.
It defines the minimal conditions under which structure is possible.
The framework is structurally complete. The derivation is closed. No further axioms can be added without breaking necessity. This repository therefore represents RP9 v1.0 (locked).The framework is released under CC-BY-NC-SA-4.0.You may:
read, share, reference, and build upon the material, provided attribution is given and derivative work preserves the same license.End of README.

index.html.description: This document provides the complete structural index of the RP9 framework.It defines: document order, hierarchical roles, and dependency relations. No interpretation is given here. This index is authoritative. Rp9 These documents constitute the entire foundation of RP9. They are non-negotiable and must be read in order. RP9 ‚Äì Axiom 0.md Single irreducible axiom. Definition F0.md Minimal functional definition derived from Axiom 0. Theorem T0.md Formal consequence of Axiom 0 and Definition F0. Corollary C0.md Necessary corollary following from Theorem T0. No document outside this group can modify or extend these statements. ## **II. Relational Derivation ‚Äî Primary to Tertiary Function**These documents describe the complete internal unfolding of the axiom. RP9 ‚Äì Relational Sheet (A).md Primary relational function ‚Äî geometric realization. RP9 ‚Äì Relational Sheet (B).md Secondary relational function ‚Äî recursion, balance, closed circuit. RP9 ‚Äì Relational Sheet (C).md Tertiary relational function ‚Äî fusion into a closed functional matrix. Together, these three documents complete the internal relational system. No further relational layers exist. ## **III. External Convergence ‚Äî Non-Foundational Material**These documents do not contribute to the validity of RP9. They exist solely for orientation, communication, and external reference. 01_RP9_and_Invariance_Why_This_Already_Works_in_Practice.md External convergence with existing invariance-based practices. 02_Public_Abstract_External_Convergence.md Concise public abstract. 03_Single_Slide_Invariance_Comparison.md Minimal visual comparison. These documents may be omitted without affecting the framework. ## **Structural Constraints** No additional axioms exist. No additional relational sheets exist. info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.
